alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 12:52PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Georgetown and southern Williamsburg Counties through 145 PM EST... At 1250 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Earle, or 20 miles southeast of Kingstree, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Some cloud to ground lightning is also expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Pawleys Island, Andrews, Trio, Warsaw, Oatland, Lambert, Sampit, Graves, Earle, Litchfield Beach and Georgetown Memorial Hospital. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
